alert.note: Alert for Fulton; Knox; Marshall; McLean; Peoria; Stark; Tazewell; Woodford (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 7:08PM CDT by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...FUNNEL CLOUDS SIGHTED OVER CENTRAL ILLINOIS... Shortly before 7 pm, spotters reported reported a couple of funnel clouds over northern Woodford County. These were along a band of showers that extended from near Canton northeast to I-39 north of Minonk. Atmospheric conditions exist that favor the possible formation of weak circulations along a pre-existing boundary. Some of these circulations are occurring underneath developing showers and thunderstorms, where a funnel cloud may develop. Once the rain begins, the funnel cloud usually dissipates. Low hanging clouds can also appear to dip up and down at times, but they will not show signs of any rapid rotation. An actual funnel cloud will exhibit spinning in a counter-clockwise direction. In rare instances these funnels may briefly touch down. Stay alert and be prepared to move to a safe shelter if a funnel cloud approaches the ground.

area.areaDesc: Fulton; Knox; Marshall; McLean; Peoria; Stark; Tazewell; Woodford
